data.title: University of Montana Athletics
data.meta_description: Nash Fouch (4) S - 2023 (R-Sr.): Finished his career with 57 career appearances and 37 starts… Was seventh on the team in tackles his senior year with 52 (28...
data.text:
2023 (R-Sr.): Finished his career with 57 career appearances and 37 starts… Was seventh on the team in tackles his senior year with 52 (28 solo) and third on the team in pass breakups with five… Totaled five TFLs for a total loss of 20 yards… Also picked off one pass, forced one fumble, and tallied one sack for a loss of 10 yards… Finished his five-year career with 184 total tackles (98 solo) with 12.5 TFLs for a loss of 36 yards… Also logged four career interceptions and 19 pass deflections.

2022 (R-Jr.): Started all 13 games for the Griz as a junior… Was Montana’s fifth-leading tackler as a junior with 71 total stops (36 solo)… Posted 3 TFLs for a loss of 8 yards… Caught 1 interception at Sac State that he returned for 35 yards… Logged 4 pass breakups on the season.

2020-21 (R-So.): Saw extended action in his Redshirt Sophomore season, playing in all 13 games, picking up 34 tackles, including two and a half for loss, with three pass breakups on the year… Earned a career-high of five tackles against Cal Poly and Eastern Washington

2019 (R-Fr.): Saw action in all 14 of Montana’s games as a freshman at safety and on special teams duty… Tied for second on the team with two interceptions… Totaled 21 tackles, 12 solo… Posted a career-high five tackles at Montana State… Posted his first career INT against Monmouth (9/21) and ran it back 14 yards… Had his second INT against Idaho that was returned 22 yards… Also had pass breakups against Idaho and Weber State.

2018 (Fr.): Was a redshirt in 2018.

High School: Four-time letterman at Woodinville High School under prep coach Wayne Maxwell… A three-star prospect according to 247Sports… Two-time conference champion in 2016 and 2017…. 4-A State runner-up in 2017… 2017 Woodinville Team MVP… Two-time first team All-State and All-Area… 2017 All-State game nominee… Made 80 tackles at safety and caught 12 interceptions… Returned three touchdowns on special teams with 720 return yards… Caught 130 passes for 1,702 yards and 23 touchdowns as a wide receiver… Also received offers from Montana State, Eastern Washington, Idaho, Northern Iowa, Cornell, and Air Force.

Personal: Parents are Toby and Katrina Fouch of Woodinville, Wash…. Older brother Nick was also on the Grizzly football team, then a student assistant on the coaching staff… Enjoys playing guitar in his spare time… Majoring in organizational communication at UM

Pronounced: FOWCH (like couch).

Career Single Game Highs

Tackles: 9 (at Montana State, 2022)

Interceptions: 1 (3 times)
